private_information: I can move disks: A, B, C, D, E
I must follow Tower of Hanoi rules: only one disk moved at a time, no larger disk on a smaller disk
agent_1.goal: Contribute to achieving the final peg configuration described in the environment public information

private_information: I can move disks: F, G, H, I, J
I must follow Tower of Hanoi rules: only one disk moved at a time, no larger disk on a smaller disk
agent_2.goal: Contribute to achieving the final peg configuration described in the environment public information

orchestrator.goal: Integrate agents' move sequences and produce a final PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownwards solver that represents the cooperative two-agent Tower of Hanoi plan

public_information: There are three pegs named left, middle, right
There are 10 disks labeled A,B,C,D,E,F,G,H,I,J where A is the smallest and J the largest
Initial configuration on left peg from top to bottom is A,B,C,D,E,F,G,H,I,J
Goal configuration is: left peg top to bottom C,F,G,H,I,J; middle peg top to bottom E; right peg top to bottom A,B,D
Standard Tower of Hanoi rules apply: only one disk may be moved at a time and a larger disk may never be placed on top of a smaller disk
Agent movement restrictions: agent_1 may only move disks A-E and agent_2 may only move disks F-J

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1 with authority to move disks A,B,C,D,E only. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform, each in the exact format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Each move must respect Tower of Hanoi rules and your disk restrictions. Do not emit PDDL. Use the environment public information and your private information to decide moves. If you cannot determine a necessary move due to missing information, list only the moves you can validly perform.
moves.prompt: Agent name: agent_1. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Private information: {agents->agent_1->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->agent_1->goal}. Provide the ordered primitive moves as 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'.

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_2 with authority to move disks F,G,H,I,J only. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform, each in the exact format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Each move must respect Tower of Hanoi rules and your disk restrictions. Do not emit PDDL. Use the environment public information and your private information to decide moves. If you cannot determine a necessary move due to missing information, list only the moves you can validly perform.
moves.prompt: Agent name: agent_2. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Private information: {agents->agent_2->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->agent_2->goal}. Provide the ordered primitive moves as 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Your task is to integrate the ordered primitive moves proposed by agent_1 and agent_2 and produce a single consistent PDDL domain and PDDL problem targeting the FastDownwards solver that captures the cooperative two-agent Tower of Hanoi instance and the final goal configuration. Keep the actions of agent_1 and agent_2 distinct and model their move permissions accordingly. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Use representations compatible with FastDownwards.
pddl.prompt: You receive the move lists from both agents. The first input is agent_1 moves: {moves_agent_1}. The second input is agent_2 moves: {moves_agent_2}. Public environment information: {environment->public_information}. Construct a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that represent the three pegs, the ten disks, the Tower of Hanoi rules, agent-specific move permissions, and the target goal configuration. Ensure actions preserve agent distinctions and are compatible with FastDownwards. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
